quest.name: Resistance Is Futile
journal:
The Vath deftarm sighs soberly.
※The difficulty of this quest will be synced to your current level.

The deftarm, feeling responsible for the misfortune that has befallen the hive, reveals to you his idea to avoid war. Having faith in the strength of his individuality, the Vath adventurer intends to willingly submit himself to the Gnath to enter their colony. Once the Overmind is lured out to claim him, he would fell the king-like Gnath, ending his threat to the Vath. The deftarm tries to reassure himself of his cause before saying farewell to you and setting off for Loth ast Gnath.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

You divulge the deftarm's plan to the storyteller and fleetfoot, who quickly deny its feasibility, explaining that the Overmind would be all too willing to use the deftarm. The fleetfoot also reveals that the Overmind cannot truly be killed, for where one dies, another soon appears. As time grows short to save the deftarm from completely losing himself, the storyteller bids you pursue him while he sends out the call for help.

You discover the deftarm, but he has already submitted himself to the thoughts of the Onemind who surround him. You dispatch them in an attempt to quell their whispers. Speak to your pupil to see if he is yet himself.
Your efforts to reach the deftarm prove fruitless, as he silently proceeds towards the Gnath colony. Continue to pursue him into the heart of the hive.

You follow the entranced deftarm deep into Loth ast Gnath, where he is welcomed by the Overmind himself. The Overmind claims triumphantly that the Vath adventurer's individuality has been removed and he has taken his place among the Onemind once more. After berating mankind for their thirst of war and discord, the Overmind hisses at you to leave his domain. He uses his power over the deftarm to raise his musket toward you, but you stand firm, trusting in your pupil's power. The storyteller soon arrives with the allies the deftarm has gathered over the course of his travels, and they attempt to call out to him. Their voices soon reach him, and the Overmind senses the imminent threat posed by the deftarm's overwhelming sense of self. Shocked beyond comprehension upon losing power over his thralls and the deftarm's assault, the Overmind soon retreats to the recesses of its lair. As impending war becomes less of a possibility, the deftarm appears to be exhausted, and suggests everyone return to the hive.

At Loth ast Vath, the deftarm attempts to thank his friends for coming to his rescue, but they brush aside his sentimentality, humor lost on the Vath. The storyteller explains how the colony has become an important part of others' lives, and their security will be guaranteed so long as the Adventurers' Guild continues to reciprocate the assistance they receive from others. The deftarm is grateful to you for taking him under your wing to guide him in the ways of adventuring, but assures you he is ready to stand on his own. In addition to his duties to the guild, he declares his resolve to continue training his skills so that he may one day embark on an adventure with you.
objectives: Search for the Vath deftarm near Loth ast Gnath.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Master, I only wished to help Loth ast Vath. A well-meaning wish. But now it seems it will ruin us. With my travels, I have greatly angered the Overmind. I have brought this misfortune upon our colony.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: It is my duty to rectify it. I thought long and hard, and there is only one way to avoid war. I will destroy the Overmind himself.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Without his guidance, the Onemind will know not what to do. They will grow confused. So confused. They cannot go to war without a leader to command them, yes?

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> So I will give myself up to Loth ast Gnath. Willingly. For the Overmind to come out of his nest, to cure me of individuality. In that moment, I will strike. If I submit myself to the Onemind's thoughts, he should not suspect. Should not. Should not...

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Master, when the storyteller spoke of true purpose, it caused me to reconsider my own. Perhaps becoming an adventurer was not my purpose at all.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Creating the guild, traveling to distant lands to secure resources, treating with the dragons... Perhaps these were to serve a greater purpose: to protect my colony.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: I will not shirk this duty. My sense of self is strong enough. I will be victorious. As I was at Anyx Trine.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Master, I cannot ask for your help this time. The storyteller will have need of you here, at the colony. Should I fail in my task, all Vath must prepare themselves for war.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Forgive me. These are...difficult things for me to say. Very difficult. But I must. So...farewell for now!

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: You look troubled, great hunter. Is there something amiss?

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: <click> <click> The fool! The Overmind will gladly welcome him into his arms!

dialogue.name: IDATEN
dialogue.text: Even should he strike down the Overmind, it will be for naught! When one falls, another rises! So it has ever been!

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: Great hunter, we are vulnerable to the Overmind, but his thoughts hold no sway over man. Only you can pursue him.

dialogue.name: IDATEN
dialogue.text: But Storyteller, even should shehe find the deftarm, there are too many drones in the hive for them to escape. Too many! The Overmind could command them all to strike at once!

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: We must try to reach him before that happens. If the deftarm enters the hive and is cleansed of his individuality, the Onemind will grow confident. Very confident indeed. His recklessness will only spur them to swifter action.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: Let us hope there is still time. I will try to summon the others, those who may be willing to help us. Hurry, great hunter, to Loth ast Gnath!

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: I make for the hunters' camp at once. Do not let the deftarm reach the hive!

dialogue.name: IDATEN
dialogue.text: We shall remain here and prepare our colony for the worst. Go!

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: (-???-)<clack> <clack> It is done. He is cured.

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: You come in vain, fleshling hunter of gods. Sense of self no longer exists in this one. He is ours once more. One with the many, in harmony.

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: Harmony that you could never hope to achieve. Your division breeds chaos. Murder. War. You do not understand peace.

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: <clack> <clack> Would that you could learn. Could link. Our harmony is beyond your kind. All submit to a single thought here. We do not quarrel.

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: <clack> <clack> But you, fleshling. You sow discord. You nurture deformity. You would murder the many.

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: <clack> <clack> If you thirst for blood, hunter, then sate it with one of your own! Leave our hive at once!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I refuse!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Release the deftarm!

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: <clack> <clack> You do not understand. The Nonmind's senses of self fester and corrupt the whole. The Nonmind threatens the natural order.

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: This one's presence is poison! Anathema! We feel it growing, gnawing. Present yet apart. Defiant.

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: No longer. It ends. Corrupted flesh must be destroyed. Before it grows and claims us.

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: <clack> <clack> We know your strength, warrior. We know your thirst. Grant him his death─or will you let him grant you yours?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Deftarm, stop!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Remember who you are, Deftarm!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Deft...arm...

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: <clack> <clack> What is this? The seams... They tear... Impossible.

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: No. We are the many. And you are one. Even if you stray, you cannot escape. You will obey.

dialogue.name: VATHSTORYTELLER
dialogue.text: <click> <click> You forget that the Vath yet have allies! Powerful allies!

dialogue.name: MARCECHAMP
dialogue.text: Give 'em hell, Deftarm! You're stronger than this!

dialogue.name: JANTELLOT
dialogue.text: You are an adventurer, are you not? Pull yourself together!

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text: Pssshkoh... Without Deftarm, who will Drydox share stinkeggs with!?

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Deftarm... Deftarm... Deftaaaaaaaaarm!

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: <clack> <clack> Whose thoughts are these!? Silence... Silence!

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: The link...it bends to his voice...to his will... One speaks louder than many!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Master? Storyteller? I know you all...and you know me!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: Yes, I am the Vath deftarm! Adventurer and protector of my colony!

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: <gasp> You... You...

dialogue.name: TSUNAGITOMESHIMONO
dialogue.text: <clack> <clack> None would dare assault us. None! You know not what you have done... Withdraw!

dialogue.name: VATHSTORYTELLER
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Those who have always followed the will of the Overmind know nothing of other powerful bonds in this world.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> I felt a great fear in him. Greater than his hate. I believe the Onemind will avoid us for some time.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> I felt such emptiness. As they feel. There were no shapes, no flavors, no moods. There were no questions, no answers. Only a single command: to obey. I could not accept such a world.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: I was able to regain myself, thanks to all of you. But now I feel so...exhausted. Let us return home, to the guild.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: <click> <click> To have reached the deftarm when we did was most fortuitous indeed. Were he lost to the Onemind completely, I fear our allies would be hesitant to intervene in a war between Gnath and Vath.

dialogue.name: IDATEN
dialogue.text: <click> <click> It seems the Gnath are the ones who are truly alone now. So lonely. Such pity we feel for those without others.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: My friends. I cannot thank you enough for coming to my aid. I─

dialogue.name: MARCECHAMP
dialogue.text: “Friends”? Now don't go thinkin' it's 'cause I'm soft. 'Cause I ain't. The hunters have been dependin' on the steady flow of arrow shafts from your guild. It'd be too much trouble to go back to fetchin' 'em ourselves.

dialogue.name: JANTELLOT
dialogue.text: That putrid incense supplied by the guild may make my eyes water, but it keeps the Convictory blessedly free of dragons.

dialogue.name: DRYDOX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Gobbies cannot get enough of guild's stinkeggs! Drydox gets shiveryshakes without them!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> I never realized that the guild had become so important to so many people.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Loth ast Vath no longer lives as a parasite, thanks to the Adventurers' Guild. Our sustainability is guaranteed as long as there are those willing to accept our help.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: The Onemind believed that we were alone, that we only survived by clinging to each other. That was their conception of a colony. To welcome strangers into the hive is unthinkable to them, and our advantage.

dialogue.name: STORYTELLER
dialogue.text: Unlike the Overmind, we can forge alliances with others to enrich our colony. They cannot ascertain our strength, and that is cause for them to leave us be. Much cause indeed.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> The Nonmind have much to be thankful for. It seems we have become too useful to those around us. We are sure to repay our wonderful allies' kindness in whatever way we can. Even so, I yearn to experience more─to explore new lands and meet new people.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: I have learned much from your lessons. But it is time to be my own master. I have burdened you long enough.

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: I know that I have much to learn, and that try as I might, I can never be as strong as you. I must develop my own strengths, and see to the guild and its future adventurers. But I hope someday to join you!

dialogue.name: UDEKIKI
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Your pupil will make you proud! Wait for me, Master!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have achieved Sworn reputation with the Vath.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, you will receive an experience point bonus upon completion of the Vath tribal daily quests.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to a wider selection of wares from the Vath stickpeddler.
